summary: Build a promotional presale website for the IcpMemeDoge memecoin featuring a special meme-dog hero image, flashy but readable design, a 24h countdown, and an ICP-based presale flow with automated payment detection, progress tracking to a 515,000 ICP cap, contributor address listing, and post-presale token crediting.
architectural_notes: Integrate with the Internet Computer/ICP ledger (or an indexer) to monitor the presale address for incoming transfers and compute cumulative raised ICP.
Persist contribution records (sender address, amount, timestamp) to support progress calculation and contributor list display.
Enforce presale cap logic: stop accepting/acknowledging contributions once total received reaches 515,000 ICP and mark presale as ended.
Decide on approach for animated hero dog (CSS animation on layered PNG/SVG, animated SVG, Lottie/WebM) and ensure it remains lightweight and doesn’t reduce readability/performance.
Decide how to handle background audio on first visit (autoplay restrictions, user consent/controls, mute/volume, and accessibility considerations).
Background audio requirement: autoplay a “cool 90s dance” track on initial page entry (while still respecting browser autoplay restrictions and providing user controls/consent as needed).
Background music should start only after an explicit user action (pressing the Play button), to comply with autoplay restrictions and user consent expectations.
User request: remove the background-music Play button UI; reassess how/if background audio can be started given autoplay restrictions and consent requirements.
known_issues: UI bug: 'ICP remaining' field should display the cap as '515.000 ICP' (German thousands separator) when no contributions are received; currently incorrect value/format.
Deployment/build failed during packaging/push to network; deployment error needs repair/enablement.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page presale website for the memecoin name “IcpMemeDoge” with a hero section, presale status section, contribution instructions, contributors list, and tokenomics section.

Apply a coherent, flashy neon meme aesthetic that uses colorful glow and subtle blinking animations while maintaining readability (accessible contrast for body text, no rapid flashing). Include a colorful glowing/blinking headline for “IcpMemeDoge”.
Add a 24-hour countdown timer that starts immediately for each visitor and counts down from 24:00:00 to 00:00:00.
Display the presale ICP deposit address exactly as provided and place it directly under the presale progress indicator, with a copy-to-clipboard control.

Implement presale progress tracking where 515,000 ICP received equals 100%. Show a progress indicator from 0% to 100%, including total ICP received and remaining ICP to cap, and mark the presale as ended once 100% is reached.

Automatically detect incoming ICP transfers to the presale address by polling from the frontend and having the backend query the ICP ledger/index source on each poll, updating totals and the contributors list accordingly.
Show a public, continuously updated list of all sender wallet addresses that have contributed ICP, including the amount contributed per address and a timestamp/ordering (most recent first).
Add tokenomics content to the landing page including: max supply of 1,000,000,000 IcpMemeDoge and the promotional claim “100% win chances after the presale” (in English).
Add clear presale parameters to the UI in English: hard cap (515,000 ICP), payment currency (ICP), and that the presale ends at 100%.
Generate and display a custom “special meme dog” hero image for IcpMemeDoge as a static frontend asset.

Make the hero meme-dog image in the Hero section visibly movable by adding a subtle, continuous animation (e.g., floating/bobbing with slight rotation) while keeping the existing image file path and overall layout intact.
Respect accessibility preferences by disabling or significantly reducing the hero image motion when the user has enabled reduced motion (prefers-reduced-motion).

Reorder the landing page sections so the full Presale Status section appears at the very top of the page (above the Hero section), while keeping all existing section content, styling, and behavior unchanged.

Update the Presale Progress UI so the 'ICP Remaining' value displays the correct cap amount as '515000 ICP' when no contributions have been received, and continues to display the correct remaining amount as contributions come in (cap minus received).

Update the Presale Progress 'ICP Remaining' statistic to display the value using a dot thousands separator so that, when no contributions have been received, it renders exactly as "515.000 ICP" (and continues to show the correct remaining amount as contributions come in, using the same thousands formatting).
Add a bundled background audio track (cool dance music) as a static frontend asset and configure it to start playing when a visitor enters the website (initial page load).
Provide persistent user controls to mute/unmute (and optionally adjust volume) for the background music, and ensure the preference persists across page reloads.
Ensure background music behavior is accessible and non-intrusive: allow keyboard operation of controls, provide appropriate ARIA labels, and avoid unexpectedly loud default volume.

Identify the root cause of the current deployment failure ("Unable to complete deployment" during packaging/push) and apply the minimal code/config changes needed so the project builds and deploys successfully again.

Add clear, user-facing error handling in the frontend for backend/polling failures so that if presale status or contributors polling fails, the UI shows an English message and remains usable (instead of silently failing or breaking rendering).

Change the background music behavior so it does not attempt to autoplay on initial page load unless the visitor has previously opted in; instead, show a persistent, unobtrusive “Play music” control that starts playback only after an explicit user action.
Keep the existing audio asset path unchanged and ensure the background music controls still support mute/unmute and volume persistence, with safe defaults that avoid unexpectedly loud playback.

Ensure that pressing the floating Play button starts playback of the bundled 90s dance background music track using the existing audio path "/assets/audio/background-dance.mp3", and that the UI correctly reflects the playing state immediately after a successful start (switching from Play to the mute/volume controls).

If playback cannot be started after the user presses the Play button (e.g., browser blocks playback or the audio asset fails to load), show a clear user-facing error message in English while keeping the page usable and leaving the Play button available for retry.

Replace the bundled background music audio that plays when the user presses the floating Play button with the track requested by the user (“Binary Finary 1999”), while keeping the existing audio URL/path used by the app unchanged ("/assets/audio/background-dance.mp3").

Refine the background music initialization so that user-initiated playback starts more reliably and quickly after pressing the floating Play button, without changing the audio asset URL (must remain exactly "/assets/audio/background-dance.mp3").

Add an explicit “starting/loading” UI state for background music playback attempts that prevents duplicate play requests and provides clear English feedback during startup (e.g., disable the Play button while a start attempt is in flight, and surface a short loading indicator/text).
Improve robustness of background music error handling and retry behavior for failed starts and failed loads, keeping all user-facing error text in English and leaving the page usable.
Remove the floating background-music Play button from the UI so that the site never renders a Play button when background music is not currently playing.
Keep the existing background-music mute and volume controls available only when background music is already playing, without adding any new way to start playback.

Add colorful, glowing/blinking but readable UI styling (including blinking colorful headline)
Implement ICP payment flow to a fixed ICP address for presale contributions
Add 24-hour countdown timer that starts immediately
Track presale progress from 0% to 100% based on total received ICP (515,000 ICP = 100%) and end presale at cap
Automatically detect incoming ICP transfers to the presale address and update the progress display
Display the presale wallet address directly under the progress indicator
Display a public list of all sender addresses that contributed ICP
After presale ends, credit purchased meme coins to investors (distribution/crediting mechanism)
Show tokenomics info including max supply of 1,000,000,000 IcpMemeDoge coins and promotional claim '100% Gewinnchancen nach dem Presale'

Define backend presale accounting so each detected ICP contribution results in an investor allocation of IcpMemeDoge tokens, credited after the presale ends. Implement a backend endpoint to fetch an address’s allocation and a global allocation summary.
Make the hero meme-dog image animated/movable (e.g., subtle motion/loop) instead of static
Move the Presale Status section to the very top of the landing page (above the hero section)
Play cool dance music when a visitor enters the website (landing page background audio)

Ensure the background music track that attempts to autoplay on initial page load is a cool 90s dance-style track, while keeping the existing audio URL/path used by the app unchanged (currently /assets/audio/background-dance.mp3).
Start 90s dance background music only when the user presses the Play button (explicit user action / opt-in)
Update the Play-button background music track to "Binary finary 1999" (use this song for the explicit user-initiated playback)

Ensure the updated bundled audio asset is included as a static frontend asset at the existing location used by the app ("/assets/audio/background-dance.mp3"), without introducing additional audio files/paths for playback.
Refine/improve background music loading and playback start behavior (e.g., faster start, more reliable initialization) when the user presses the Play button
Remove/delete the (floating) background-music Play button from the UI
